nodes.description: Vice President of Global Design and Product Engineering, Steelcase
nodes.whoTheyAre: An architect and industrial designer, James Ludwig is responsible for the design direction and development of all Steelcase products and spaces worldwide.

nodes.whatOthersSay: I view design as embracive. Everything we interact with, including products, tools, signage, the way we interface with machines and the whole digital technological realm, requires a designer to be the translator between ‘it’ and ‘you’.
nodes.whoTheyAre: Chee Pearlman creates conversations among designers -- think of her as as the host of a worldwide, perpetual salon.
nodes.whyListen:
Journalist, conference creator and curator, Chee Pearlman has been a vital voice in the world of design. After a legendary stint as editor-in-chief of I.D. Magazine and then as director of Chee Company, a New York-based editorial and design consultancy, she is currently the design curator at TED. She was a 2011 Harvard Loeb Fellow and the curator of the acclaimed 2016 exhibition "Isaac Mizrahi: An Unruly History."

With David Rockwell, Pearlman was cocurator of the TED2012 session "The Design Studio."

videoData.description: The COVID-19 pandemic has upended how we think about the workplace. TED curator Chee Pearlman and James Ludwig, vice president of global design and product engineering at Steelcase, discuss how we can use this time as an opportunity to reflect on what matters most – and make the office of the future even better in the process. (Recorded June 16, 2020)
